text: the Gateway dishes for converting an
eggplant hater you could do deep fried
eggplant or you could do eggplant dip
guess which one is easier I'm just going
to separate the pita just basically
cutting it open then what I'm going to
do is make an herb oil I'm kind of
basing this herb oil loosely on a fresh
sitar zatar is a Middle Eastern spice
mix usually made with dried herbs you'd
use oregano thyme and it usually has
sesame in it but I'm gonna skip the
sesame in this case a quarter teaspoon
of salt and I'm gonna add olive oil I'm
gonna mix this together and I'm just
gonna brush it all over the pita breads
and then I'm gonna grill them
just puree it until you can't take it
anymore you can still see bits of the
herb leaves they're not completely
pureed but that's fine and then once
they're coated with the herb oil I'm
just gonna grill them for about a minute
or so on each side now you want to cut
these into wedges while they're cool
enough to handle but still warm because
if you let them cool entirely they're
just gonna crumble to bits and then the
little crumbly bets just leave those on
the platter kids'll eat them I might eat
them your window on these is actually
pretty narrow so you really want to
start cutting them the second they don't
burn your hands you don't have to make
your own herb pita chips to go with the
eggplant dip but I feel like it just
makes it that much more special
so I got some nice skinny little
eggplant I think these are the best ones
to use for this because the flesh is
really nice and dense it's not watery
and it also picks up the smoke really
well cover it catch every little bit of
smoke and then let that sit until the
eggplants completely collapse as soon as
the eggplant is cool enough to handle
you want to peel it generally if you've
grilled it really really soft it'll just
come right off and then you can just
kind of smoosh it into the bowl just
it'll fall right in by the way if you
get a little of the peel in that is okay
it actually adds an extra layer of
smokiness now the hard part is over all
you have to do is just mush everything
up in the blender I've got my eggplant
go eggplant goop is the technical term
for guts eggplant guts this dip is
similar to a baba ghanoush but when you
make a baba ghanoush you use tahini and
I'm using Greek yogurt so it's more like
a Greek eggplant dip this is a garlic
very finely chopped we're gonna do half
a lemon
I'm probably gonna have to correct the
seasoning at the end so I'm gonna start
with half a lemon and then go from there
and you don't wanna get the pits in here
because the blender will not grind up
those pits and if it did it would
actually be very bitter and then of
course you need salt and pepper you just
want to use a teeny bit of olive oil in
the dip I'm gonna add more on top so
just a little bit
now you want to taste it at this point
while it's still in here so that you can
add more seasonings right to the blender
bowl actually it's good doesn't need any
more lemon I want to make the garnish is
appealing and gorgeous as possible so
I'm gonna use some pomegranate seeds
which sounds odd but it's actually
excellent with eggplant then I'm going
to use some dates some chopped up dates
don't overdo the dates though because
they're powerfully sweet that looks
about right and then some fresh mint I'm

just a little mmm
